PHP3783 - Modernity as a Philosophical P.name: PHP3783 - Modernity as a Philosophical Problem

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Modernity in the philosophies of Kant, Hegel, Nietzsche, Heidegger, Derrida, Rorty, and others.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the development, meaning, and implications of a central concept in Philosophy.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing and three Philosophy courses.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The philosophy developed in the 20th century in the writings of Husserl, Heidegger, Sartre, Merleau-Ponty, De Beauvoir and Derrida.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of a central figure in philosophy's work, influences, reception and effect.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing or PHI 2010 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of existentialist analysis and criticism of the human situation as found in the writings of such philosophers as Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Heidegger, Sartre, and Camus.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete the following: 
PHI2010 - Introduction to Philosophy (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of contemporary African-American philosophy and overview of Black philosophy from slavery era writings to the present.
